awd_titl_txt: Mesoscale Precipitation:  Analysis Simulation and           Forecasting Conference - MIT, Sept. 1988
awd_abstract_narration: The conference brings together meteorologists, hydrologists and                 civil engineers to discuss advances made in the simulation of                   precipitation at mesoscale or catchment scale.  This meeting is a               follow up of the first meeting of this nature that took place in                March 1986.  In the past two years considerable progress has been               made.  New operational mesoscale precipitation models exist; new                multidimensional stochastic models of precipitation have been                   proposed; significant new data sets are available; large                        experiments are planned; and recent results of research question                the concept of clustering at the convective cell scale.  The                    interaction between these research communities is timely and will               benefit the forecasting of floods.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
